content: **ptiloris hat** is a simple unisex beanie made with sport weight yarn in two colors the colorwork pattern is inspired by plumage on a breast of the paradise riflebird ptiloris paradiseus with its subtle transition from black to gray but there s no need to keep to only these colors any two colors can be used depending on your preference this hat is a perfect project for a first venture in colorwork knitting pattern contains both chart and written instructions for colorwork part of the hat for every step there are helpful video tutorials there is also a tutorial for a fleece lining for a hat if you have sensitive skin on your forehead or just don t want to have an imprint of a ribbing after wearing a hat or if your winter is too cold and windy for a hat made with relatively thin yarn give it a try the link for a complete video tutorial for lining is provided **difficulty level** beginner intermediate experienced **techniques used** knit purl working in the round on circular needles working small circumferences in the round on dpns/with magic loop or with two circulars stranded colorwork decreases crochet cast on optional **sizes** s 20 51 cm head circumference m 21 53 cm **pattern notes** ptiloris hat is knit in the round from the bottom up crochet cast on provides stable and sufficiently stretchy beginning for 2 by 2 ribbing other stretchy cast on may be used if you have a preferred one the body of the hat continues with simple colorwork pattern that will be perfect
